title: US Man Told His Sons They Were "The Best Boys Ever" Before Killing Them
content: On Friday, he pleaded guilty and was sentenced to three consecutive life terms in prison.
summary: On Friday, he pleaded guilty and was sentenced to three consecutive life terms in prison.

title: Bangladesh Interim Government Led By Nobel Winner To Take Oath Tomorrow
content: The interim government in Bangladesh led by Nobel-laureate Muhammad Yunus will take oath tomorrow, the nation's army chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman said today. General Waker told reporters the interim government is likely to take oath at 8 pm.
summary: The interim government in Bangladesh led by Nobel-laureate Muhammad Yunus will take oath tomorrow, the nation's army chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman said today. General Waker told reporters the interim government is likely to take oath at 8 pm.

title: Nearly 40,000 And Counting: The Struggle To Keep Track Of Gaza Deaths
content: With much of Gaza reduced to rubble by 10 months of war, counting the dead has become a challenge for the Hamas-run territory's health ministry, as the death toll nears 40,000.
summary: With much of Gaza reduced to rubble by 10 months of war, counting the dead has become a challenge for the Hamas-run territory's health ministry, as the death toll nears 40,000.

title: 2 Dead, Several Feared Trapped After Hotel In Germany Collapses
content: Rescue teams were Wednesday working to free people trapped after part of a hotel collapsed in western Germany, killing two and injuring several others, authorities said.
summary: Rescue teams were Wednesday working to free people trapped after part of a hotel collapsed in western Germany, killing two and injuring several others, authorities said.

title: "Brave Children Made Impossible Possible": Ex Bangladesh PM Amid Chaos
content: Ex Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia, released from prison after Sheikh Hasina ouster, says "brave children made impossible possible"
summary: Ex Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia, released from prison after Sheikh Hasina ouster, says "brave children made impossible possible"

title: China, Saudi, UAE Agree To Roll Over Pak's $12 Billion Debt For A Year
content: China, Saudi Arabia and the UAE have agreed to roll over cash-strapped Pakistan's $12 billion debt for one year, as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is likely to approve its $7 billion bailout package later this month.
summary: China, Saudi Arabia and the UAE have agreed to roll over cash-strapped Pakistan's $12 billion debt for one year, as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is likely to approve its $7 billion bailout package later this month.

title: 4 Chinese Passengers, Pilot Killed In Helicopter Crash In Nepal
content: A helicopter crashed in central Nepal on Wednesday, killing all five people aboard including the pilot and four Chinese tourists.
summary: A helicopter crashed in central Nepal on Wednesday, killing all five people aboard including the pilot and four Chinese tourists.

title: "Refrain From All Kinds Of Violence": Bangladesh Interim Caretaker To People
content: Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus, who is set to lead an interim government after the premier was ousted, called for calm and urged people to use the opportunity to build a better nation.
summary: Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus, who is set to lead an interim government after the premier was ousted, called for calm and urged people to use the opportunity to build a better nation.

title: Video: Pet Dog In US Starts House Fire After Chewing On Lithium-Ion Battery
content: Fortunately, all pets escaped the burning home through a dog door, and the family was also safely evacuated.
summary: Fortunately, all pets escaped the burning home through a dog door, and the family was also safely evacuated.

title: Russia Says Ukraine Launched Missiles, Drones Shot Down Over Kursk Region
content: Ukraine lobbed missiles and drones at Russia's southwest region of Kursk overnight, the local governor said Wednesday, a day after pro-Kyiv forces stormed across the border with tanks and armoured vehicles.
summary: Ukraine lobbed missiles and drones at Russia's southwest region of Kursk overnight, the local governor said Wednesday, a day after pro-Kyiv forces stormed across the border with tanks and armoured vehicles.

title: India Evacuates Embassy Officials From Bangladesh Amidst Unrest
content: India has evacuated all non-essential staff and their families from its embassy and consulates in Bangladesh, sources have confirmed.
summary: India has evacuated all non-essential staff and their families from its embassy and consulates in Bangladesh, sources have confirmed.

title: Blog: The Complex Emotions Bangladesh And Its Crisis Evoke In Me, An Indian
content: Alongside the term 'ghuspaithiye' and the range of emotions it evokes, there is a mix of empathy, pain, shared legacy, and a common love for Rabindra Sangeet - all experienced in varying degrees and at different times.
summary: Alongside the term 'ghuspaithiye' and the range of emotions it evokes, there is a mix of empathy, pain, shared legacy, and a common love for Rabindra Sangeet - all experienced in varying degrees and at different times.

title: Tom Cruise To Perform Deadly Stunts For Paris Olympics Closing Ceremony
content: Two weeks after the unprecedented complexity of the opening ceremony along the River Seine, there are big expectations for the show to wrap up the Games.
summary: Two weeks after the unprecedented complexity of the opening ceremony along the River Seine, there are big expectations for the show to wrap up the Games.

title: World's Cities Are Growing Upward Than Outward, Says Satellite Study
content: Cities are increasingly growing upward instead of outward, with Asian cities leading the way. Previously, cities expanded by occupying more territory.
summary: Cities are increasingly growing upward instead of outward, with Asian cities leading the way. Previously, cities expanded by occupying more territory.

title: TikTok Maker ByteDance Launch Text-To-Video AI App, Rivals OpenAI's Sora
content: The launch of a text-to-video model by the parent of short video app firm TikTok follows a series of similar model releases in recent months in China.
summary: The launch of a text-to-video model by the parent of short video app firm TikTok follows a series of similar model releases in recent months in China.

title: "Attacking Temples, Parliament...": Sheikh Hasina's Son On Bangladesh Turmoil
content: Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina son has expressed concern over the attacks on his mother's party leaders and minorities in the country amid massive political turmoil.
summary: Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina son has expressed concern over the attacks on his mother's party leaders and minorities in the country amid massive political turmoil.

title: Elon Musk's X Sues Group Over "Illegal" Ad Boycott That Cost Billions
content: Elon Musk's X Corp. filed a lawsuit accusing an industry group of violating antitrust laws for an advertising boycott that cost the social media company billions of dollars.
summary: Elon Musk's X Corp. filed a lawsuit accusing an industry group of violating antitrust laws for an advertising boycott that cost the social media company billions of dollars.

title: NASA Delays SpaceX ISS Mission As Boeing Starliner Faces Issues
content: NASA on Tuesday postponed the departure of astronauts bound for the International Space Station on a SpaceX flight due to ongoing issues with Boeing's Starliner spacecraft.
summary: NASA on Tuesday postponed the departure of astronauts bound for the International Space Station on a SpaceX flight due to ongoing issues with Boeing's Starliner spacecraft.

title: "Don't Stain Dreams": Bangladesh Band After Singer Home, Instruments Burnt
content: Rahul Ananda and his family members managed to escape unharmed, but a huge number of musical instruments were reduced to ash as rioters set fire to the house.
summary: Rahul Ananda and his family members managed to escape unharmed, but a huge number of musical instruments were reduced to ash as rioters set fire to the house.

title: 20 Leaders Of Sheikh Hasina's Party Found Dead As Bangladesh Protests Continue
content: Twenty bodies of Awami League leaders have been found across Bangladesh after former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina left the nation, following violent protests by students over giving job quota to freedom fighters' children.
summary: Twenty bodies of Awami League leaders have been found across Bangladesh after former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina left the nation, following violent protests by students over giving job quota to freedom fighters' children.
